abstract: Twitter Valuations| The Myth of Market Making?| Pay and Risk
snippet: Twitter Valuations| The Myth of Market Making?| Pay and Risk
lead_paragraph: Google’s Schmidt Sees ‘Bubble’  Google has made 87 acquisitions worth $8.4 billion in the last 10 years, but the recent high valuations placed on some high-profile Internet companies has Eric Schmidt scratching his head. “There are clear signs of a bubble,” Mr. Schmidt told the Swiss magazine Bilanz. “But valuations are what they are.” Reuters (For those DealBook readers who read German — or who perhaps those who will work at the New York Stock Exchange — here’s a link to Bilanz.)
